CSSKeyframesRule.summary: The CSSKeyframesRule interface describes an object representing a complete set of keyframes for a CSS animation. It corresponds to the contents of a whole @keyframes at-rule.

CSSKeyframesRuleAppendRule.summary: The appendRule() method of the interface appends a to the end of the rules.

CSSKeyframesRuleCssRules.summary: The read-only cssRules property of the interface returns a containing the rules in the keyframes at-rule.

blockquote.para: The CSSKeyframeRule itself is indexable like an array, and functions similarly to its cssRules property.

CSSKeyframesRuleDeleteRule.summary: The deleteRule() method of the interface deletes the that matches the specified keyframe selector.

CSSKeyframesRuleFindRule.summary: The findRule() method of the interface finds the that matches the specified keyframe selector.
CSSKeyframesRuleFindRule.returns: A which is the last matching rule. If no rules are found, nothing is returned.

CSSKeyframesRuleLength.summary: The read-only length property of the interface returns the number of objects in its list. You can then access each keyframe rule by its index directly on the CSSKeyframeRule object.
CSSKeyframesRuleLength.value: A non-negative integer. It should have the same value as the length of the property.

CSSKeyframesRuleName.summary: The name property of the interface gets and sets the name of the animation as used by the {{cssxref("animation-name")}} property.
